title: Invigorating the market
description: KUALA LUMPUR (March 16): Nearly five months after taking the hot seat at the Securities Commission Malaysia (SC)
pubDate:
chairman Datuk Syed Zaid Albar is charting a transformative agenda forward for the capital market.

In his first interview since assuming office
column5: Syed Zaid outlines his 'AAA' vision that aims to energise the capital markets to become more vibrant
column6:
inclusive and agile.

A big part of those plans will entail attracting the next generation of investors who are so far not very keen on participating in the good old stock market.

KUALA LUMPUR (March 15): The non-performing assets held by Lembaga Tabung Haji (LTH) have been transferred to Urusharta Jamaah Sdn Bhd
column72: which is wholly owned by the Ministry of Finance
column73:
at a hefty premium of RM9.9 billion for assets worth RM10 billion.

The premium for the equity stakes in public-listed companies was as high as 36 times (please see list). The 29.8% stake in TH Heavy Engineering Bhd is an example. Urusharta Jamaah paid RM380.3 million for the block of 334.16 million shares
column74:

Macau casino licenses for MGM China
column93: HONG KONG (Mar 15): Macau
column95: has extended casino licenses for MGM China and SJM Holdings until 2022
column96: bringing them on par with other operators
column97:
authorities in the Chinese territory said on Friday.

The Macau government said the MGM and SJM's licenses
column99:
would be extended for another two years with both operators required to pay a one-off fee of 200 million patacas ($25 million).

Shares in MGM jumped 10 percent while those in SJM rose over 5 percent after resuming trading following the announcement.
